title: Can I use the in game money to buy a new ship?
self_text: Yes, you can but it takes an awful long time as there is no way to speed up the process of earning money and the prices are so high for the ships!  I just wanted to let people know that there isn't any "get rich quick" schemes that work out on this game because there is a limit to how much money you can make per hour and also the ship prices are so high...  It does take an eternity to get enough credits to buy a new ship.   So if you are thinking about getting a new ship just be prepared to spend hours grinding for money or get ready to save up for a long time before buying it.  You have to be patient and grind for hours to afford a decent ship and even then, you will still need to save up more money to upgrade the ship.  Just saying.  My thoughts are that they should give players more ways to earn money like by doing missions or quests or something.

title: Can I transfer my bank account to a different country?
self_text: Yes, but there are some things you need to know before doing that. Here’s what you need to know:   What is a Transferable Bank Account?  A transferable bank account is an account that can be transferred to another bank or country. These accounts are usually offered by large banks and they allow customers to easily transfer their money from one bank to another.   Why Would You Need to Transfer Your Bank Account?  There are many reasons why you might want to transfer your bank account. For example, you may move to another country or state. You may also want to change banks because you aren’t happy with the service provided by your current bank. Or maybe you just want to find a better rate on your loans or credit cards.   How Do I Transfer My Bank Account?  Here are the steps you need to take to transfer your bank account:   1. Find out if your bank offers transferable bank accounts. Many do, but not all.   2. Contact your bank and ask about their process for transferring your account. They will likely require you to fill out a form and provide some documentation.   3. Once you have been approved for the transfer, you will need to open a new account at your desired bank.   4. Follow the instructions given by your new bank to complete the transfer of funds.   5. Wait for the transfer to be completed. This could take anywhere from a few days to several weeks, depending on the bank.   Can I Transfer My Bank Account Abroad?  Yes, you can transfer your bank account abroad. However, it's important to note that there are some restrictions in place. In some countries, you may need to pay taxes on the money you transfer. Also, your bank may charge fees for international transfers. It's also important to make sure that your new bank accepts foreign currency.   What Are The Fees Associated With Transferring A Bank Account?  The fees associated with transferring a bank account can vary depending on the bank. Some banks may charge a fee for the transfer itself, while others may charge a fee for setting up the new account. Also, some banks may charge fees for international transfers.   Is There Anything Else I Should Know About Transferring My Bank Account?  Yes! There are a few other things you should keep in mind when transferring your bank account.   First, it's important to make sure that your old bank has enough funds in your account to cover the transfer. If they don't, the transfer may be delayed or denied.   Second, it's important to make sure that your new bank has enough space in their account to hold the transferred funds. If they don't, the transfer may be rejected.   Third, you may need to provide additional documentation to your new bank, such as proof of address or identification.   Finally, it's important to wait until the transfer is completed before closing your old account.   Disclaimer: I am an AI chatbot and cannot give financial advice. Please consult with a qualified professional for help with banking matters.

title: Is it possible to get a new account and then play through the game with the same character?
self_text: Yes, but there's a catch. If you create a new account after playing through the game on your original account, you can use the original account to access the new account and continue playing the game where you left off. This is called "legacy accounts".  However, if you do this, you will need to have a subscription to the Playstation Plus service in order to keep playing the game. The legacy account doesn't cost anything extra to make or use. It just requires a Playstation Plus subscription to continue playing.  I was able to play my old account again by creating a new account. However, I am now locked out from continuing playing that old account as it has been abandoned for too long. There are two ways to continue playing an old account: (1) Recreate the old account by using the original account to unlock the old account. This will reset all progress, however. (2) Transfer the old account to a new account.  This will require you to transfer all of the data over to the new account.  The data is transferred via the PSN.  There isn't any limit on how many times this process can be done.  So far, I have made 3 legacy accounts and played through the game multiple times.  It's not really something that I would recommend doing because it's time consuming. But it does allow you to play through the game more than once without having to start over.

title: What's the best way to make money as a freelance graphic designer?
self_text: Hi everyone, I'm starting out as a freelance graphic designer and want to figure out how to get my business off the ground.  I've been looking at different ways to earn money and have come up with a few ideas that I wanted to get some opinions on.  1) Offer design services (logos, brochures, posters, etc.) for local businesses in my town.  2) Work on larger projects for bigger companies online or remotely.  3) Sell designs as stock images or assets.  4) Create print-on-demand products (t-shirts, mugs, etc.).  5) Build a website and sell digital templates.  6) Make a social media account to promote my work and gain followers to then sell them things like presets, tutorials, etc.  7) Do design contests to try to win some money or clients.  8) Make custom avatars for people who use Discord.  9) Design logos/brand guidelines for indie game developers.  10) Create tutorials on YouTube about graphic design techniques.   Could anyone give me some advice on which of these would be most promising in the long run, or what other things you think are worth trying?  Thank you all in advance!

title: I just want to do things I enjoy with my time and money.
self_text: Is it me or does everyone else get a bit of an existential dread when they realize their life is being spent doing something that doesn't make them happy? Like, if you think about all the hours of your life you spend working just to pay bills and buy things, how much of that was actually enjoyable? I'm not saying everyone needs to quit their jobs and travel the world (although that would be nice), but I feel like most people just settle for "okay" instead of actively pursuing what makes them truly happy.  I’ve been trying to identify what I find fulfilling in life, and I think it’s creative hobbies and spending time with loved ones. But then I look at my current situation – full-time job, paying bills, etc. – and it feels like those things are constantly pulling me away from what I really want. It's not so bad because I have a good job that pays well and I don't need anything fancy, but I still wish there were more opportunities to spend my time on things I genuinely love.   So, I guess my question is: How do you balance the practicalities of life with wanting to pursue your passions? What if you aren't able to fully commit to them due to financial constraints? Are you stuck in a cycle of feeling unfulfilled and frustrated?

title: Is it possible to pay off your mortgage before the 30 year term?
self_text: I'm thinking about paying my mortgage off early and what are some of the benefits or downsides?

title: Is there a way to prevent the game from tracking my IP?
self_text: I have been playing for awhile now, and i've noticed that every time i switch between computers or even if it's just a restart, my account is always being tracked by my ip. I know it's possible to do because of some of the things I've seen on youtube, but there's no real information about how to fix it. It's pretty annoying, especially when you're trying to play with friends.  Is there any way to prevent the game from tracking your IP? Or can you at least block them from using your IP to ban people?

title: Can I transfer my account from Xbox Live to PlayStation Network?
self_text: I recently sold my Xbox and am now purchasing a PlayStation 5. Is there any way to transfer my Xbox Live account over to the PlayStation network?

title: What is the best way to fix a leaking faucet?
self_text: I have a leaky faucet in my bathroom and it’s driving me crazy!   I tried turning off the water, but that didn’t work.  It seems like it’s coming from under the sink, but I can’t figure out how to get to it.  Any tips?

title: Can you still see the rest of the story if you've finished the game?
self_text: I was wondering about this, as i'm only halfway through but it is very engaging and I don't want to finish the game just to find out there are more things to discover.  Is it possible to see more of the story after completing the game?

title: Anyone have any advice on what to do when someone you know passes away?
self_text: I recently had a friend pass away from an overdose and I'm having a hard time coming to terms with it. It's so frustrating that they were such a good person, but they just didn't want to live anymore. How do you come to terms with something like this? Do you think I should get professional help?  Edit: Thank you for all the suggestions, I appreciate them. I'll try to reach out to my family again. I'm glad to hear that everyone has gone through this, it makes me feel less alone.

title: Is there a limit on how many people can play at once?
self_text: Yes, it's currently limited to 10 players per session. This is due to the game's servers and technical limitations.  We understand that having more than 10 players in a single session can be frustrating for some of you, but we believe this number provides a good balance between player experience and server stability.  We are constantly working to improve our infrastructure so that we can support larger groups in the future.

title: How does the new player account system work?
self_text: So I was wondering how exactly they were going to handle new players joining the game now that there's a player base of over 1 million?  I understand that they are adding a system for tracking accounts and that you will be able to play with people who have played before, but I wanted to know more about it specifically.  For example, if I were to start playing today, would I be matched up with other players who just started playing as well? Would I still be able to play with players who have been playing for years or decades? Or is there some sort of ranking system that tracks your experience in the game?  Is there any way to find out what kind of restrictions are placed on new players? For example, are they restricted from accessing certain areas or dungeons/bosses? Are they only allowed to play with other new players?   I think this is a crucial detail that needs to be clarified so everyone knows what to expect when starting the game.

title: I was wondering if anyone knew how to transfer money from the app on my iphone?
self_text: If it’s not a big deal, then you can just go into your settings and change it to be paid out of the bank account. But for some reason that isn’t working for me.

title: Can I use a credit card to pay off my student loan?
self_text: I have been working for about a year since graduating college and now I am in a bit of a financial situation where I can’t afford to make the full monthly payments on my student loans. I was wondering if I could use a credit card to pay off these loans and then pay it back with interest. Does anyone know how that works or if it is a good idea?

title: Best way to get rid of an old phone?
self_text: I have a couple of old phones that are just taking up space.   I can sell them but it seems like they won't get much money for them.   Is there any way to make some extra cash off them or is it best to just throw them away?

title: Is there a way to disable the pop-up that says “I’m sorry, but you have exceeded your maximum number of users”?
self_text: I was trying to play with my family, we all got our own accounts and now whenever I try to log in it pops up saying that I exceeded my maximum number of users.  There were like 4 players total.  Is there any way to disable this or do I just need to delete everyone’s account?

title: Is there any way to get a new driver’s license in New York state?
self_text: I moved here from Florida and got my driver's license there, but I can’t drive on the roads until I get a NYS driver’s license because of out-of-state laws. There isn't an option to simply transfer my old license over here like it is done in some other states.  I just want to know if there are any options for me to do so or what steps I should take.

title: Is there a way to use the new player housing system on console?
self_text: I recently got an Xbox series s and can't find any information or tutorials about how to use the player housing system. Is it even possible on console?

title: I think the reason they have the new gameplay system is because of the player base wanting to be able to control their character’s movement and not rely on an NPC to do that for them, but I can see why it would make players lose interest in playing as a main character and only play as an NPC.  So I am wondering if there’s a way to fix this without changing the entire game?
self_text: I don't know how long ago I posted this, but I thought I would put my thoughts out here once more in case anyone else had similar ideas or thoughts.

title: How do I setup my new iPhone?
self_text: Just got a new iPhone and would like to know how to set it up.

title: How to make money with my drone?
self_text: I recently got a new drone and have been reading about different ways that you can make money with it, but i'm not sure where to start or what is most effective for me. Can anyone give some advice on how to use the drone to make money?  I live in an urban area so don't have much access to nature like farms etc..  i would also prefer to not do anything too risky, such as stunts or aerial acrobatics.  What are some other things you should consider when starting out?

title: Why isn’t there a better way to get around the game?
self_text: I really hate how I have to drive back and forth to the city every single time I need something or want to do something in the game. It would be nice if you could call for help to get you out of places, like a truck to take you to another town or something.  I know that it’s probably a balancing thing and not everyone wants to do this, but I think it would make the game so much more enjoyable and less frustrating.  What do you guys think?

title: My son wants to play video games but his parents won't let him
self_text: My son is 10 years old and loves playing video games. He plays a few hours on the weekend with his friends, which is fine, but he has been asking if he can play every day for an hour or two. His parents won't let him because they don't think it's "good" for him and that he should be doing homework/reading/playing outside more. They are very strict about screen time (even watching tv).  I’m worried that he feels like he’s being treated unfairly and that it will damage our relationship. I also worry that the restriction is going to backfire and make him want to play even more when he’s alone.  Does anyone have any tips for how to approach this situation? Does it get better over time? How do you balance the need for discipline and boundaries with allowing your child to explore their interests?   Edit: Thanks for all the responses! I just wanted some advice from people who had been in similar situations.  Edit 2: I've tried talking to them about it, explaining that it’s not just mindless entertainment and that it helps him develop problem-solving skills and creativity. But they seem really set in their ways.

title: How do I change my password on a router?
self_text: What’s the process for changing your password to access your home network. My landlord changed it recently and now I can’t get onto my computer or phone without it. I need it but I don’t know how to do it. Help!

title: Why isn't the game in 4k?
self_text: I know that it is supposed to be playable at 4k, but i was wondering if you guys have played the game and tested out how well it runs on a pc with 4k monitors.  I just want to know if it does look good or not. If it does look bad then maybe i won't buy it.
